interface.name: bash-cached-completions
interface.description:
To enable, put the following in your bashrc:
. $(0launch http://gfxmonk.net/dist/0install/bashcomplete.xml __init)
An easy way to generate a set of bash completion words. Word sets are cached, and generated in the background (so your terminal doesn't hang).
The config is all written in python, because python is ace. Every set of words is tied to the cache_key you generate - if you return the same cache_key, the completion will re-use the same set of words. If completion depends on existing arguments, you will need to factor that into your cache_key generation.
Example setup: To enable completions for "my-command":
----------------------------------------- ~/.config/bashcomplete/my-command.py:
max_age = 5 * 60 # 5 minutes
def cache_key(command, args): import os return os.getcwd()
def get_words(command, args): import time time.sleep(2) # won't lock bash return ['aaa','bbbb','cccc', 'ccdd']
